newsitem.title: INDONESIA: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - April 25.
newsitem.headline: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - April 25.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors likely to affect Indonesian stocks on Friday:

* On Thursday, the Dow Jones industrial average fell 20.47 points to close at 6,792.25, falling back from a rise of nearly 80 points in the first hour of trading, as long-term bond interest rates jumped ahead of next week's slew of economic data.
* Indonesia's ousted minority party leader Megawati Sukarnoputri urged party members and supporters on Thursday not to participate in the general election campaign that begins on Sunday.

* The rupiah fell 15 points on Thursday on election concerns before recovering partially at the close. It slid again on Friday, being quoted at 2,437.75/38.70 at 0215 GMT, compared with an opening of 2,4332.00/33.00.
* On Thursday, the composite index rose 1.53 points to close at 652.98 points.
* Cement firm Cibinong, oil firm Medco and glass manufacturer Asahimas following announcements of their 1996 results.
* Small property firm Suryamas on market talk of a possible link-up with a foreign property firm.
* Telkom after reports the firm would pay a dividend of 41.25 rupiah per share for 1996.
* Bank Bira after a sharp rise in the firm's first quarter net profit.
* Small-sized property firm Elang Realty on continued market talk of a possible rights issue.
